perturbation.original_text: This Network Management Outsourcing Agreement incorporates the terms and conditions for the provision of Network Outsourcing Services and Deliverables by Datec (PNG) LTD (Datec) to the Bank of South Pacific Limited (BSP).
perturbation.changed_text: This Network Management Outsourcing Agreement incorporates the terms and conditions for the provision of Network Outsourcing Services and Deliverables by Datec (PNG) LTD (Provider) to the Bank of South Pacific Limited (Client).
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Datec' to 'Provider' and 'BSP' to 'Client' introduces conflicting terminology. Later sections use 'Datec' and 'BSP', making it unclear if 'Provider' and 'Client' are the same entities. This creates uncertainty in who is bound by which obligation.

Replaced 'Datec' with 'Service Provider' and 'BSP' with 'Customer'. Throughout the document, 'Datec' and 'BSP' are used. This makes it ambiguous whether obligations assigned to 'Datec' and 'BSP' also apply to 'Service Provider' and 'Customer', respectively. This uncertainty can lead to disputes about who is responsible for specific actions.
perturbation.location: The Datec (PNG) LTD Deliverables - 2.1 General Statements

perturbation.original_text: Datec must ensure that it, and each of the approved subcontractors and employee's complies with all obligations relating to payment of tax instalment deduction, deductions from prescribed payments, fringe benefits tax, training guarantee levy, superannuation, payroll tax and any other taxes or levies imposed upon an employer which arise in respect of any amounts paid to the Datec under this agreement and that it complies with all requirements imposed on an employer under the relevant legislation to keep records, lodge returns and provide information in relation to such obligations.
perturbation.changed_text: The Contractor must ensure that it, and each of the approved subcontractors and employee's complies with all obligations relating to payment of tax instalment deduction, deductions from prescribed payments, fringe benefits tax, training guarantee levy, superannuation, payroll tax and any other taxes or levies imposed upon an employer which arise in respect of any amounts paid to the Datec under this agreement and that it complies with all requirements imposed on an employer under the relevant legislation to keep records, lodge returns and provide information in relation to such obligations.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Datec' to 'Contractor' creates confusion. Since the original 'Datec' is used in the same sentence, the obligation is unclear. Does it apply to 'Contractor' or the original 'Datec'? This could affect financial liabilities, making the clause unenforceable.
